conclusion: The problem asks to predict which container (D, E, or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles from points A, B, and C.
There are three openings at the top labeled A (orange), B (blue), and C (white).
There are three containers at the bottom labeled D (blue), E (white), and F (black).
There are five baffles in the image: purple, green, cyan, brown, and white, arranged diagonally.
The baffles are positioned such that they can direct the flow of liquid from the top openings to the bottom containers.
Liquid from A will hit the purple baffle and be directed towards the green baffle.
The green baffle will direct the liquid from A towards container D.
Liquid from B will hit the cyan baffle and be directed towards the white baffle.
The white baffle will direct the liquid from B towards container E.
Liquid from C will hit the brown baffle and be directed towards container F.
The liquid from A will flow into container D, from B into container E, and from C into container F.
